task.title: Removing Carbon from the Combustion Chamber
task.shortdesc: Follow these steps to safely remove carbon buildup from the engine's combustion chamber and cylinder head.

prereq.p: Ensure the engine is cool before beginning this procedure.

substep.cmd: Locate the pet cock at the bottom of the radiator
Open the pet cock to drain the water

step.cmd: Disconnect the electrical and cooling components

substep.cmd: Disconnect the wires at the top of the motor
Remove the radiator connection attached to the radiator
Remove the 15 cap screws holding the cylinder head in place
Using a putty knife or screwdriver, carefully scrape the carbonized matter from the cylinder head
Clean the carbon from the top of the pistons

stepresult.note: Take care to prevent carbon particles from falling into the cylinders or bolt holes.

substep.cmd: Rotate the motor until pistons No. 1 and No. 4 are at top center
Place the new gasket in position over the pistons
Set the cylinder head in place

info.note: Tighten the cylinder head bolts gradually and evenly. Do not fully tighten bolts on one end before tightening the other end.

substep.cmd: Install all cylinder head bolts finger-tight
Gradually tighten each bolt a few turns at a time in a cross-pattern sequence
